oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Joseph Delaney, Self-Portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Delaney, Joseph
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Artists
African American artists
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Head and shoulders, three-quarter facing portrait of a handsome young man with dark, short cropped hair, wearing a dark suit, white shirt, and red tie. Signed lower left: Jos. Delaney 1933.

Artist Joseph Delaney (1904-1991) was born in Knoxville. His older brother Beauford also became quite well-known as an artist. Joseph studied at the Art Students League in New York and lived and worked in the city until his return to Knoxville in 1986. He served as an artist in residence at the University of Tennessee during the final years of his life.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
